verses.kjv: And it came to pass after this, that Absalom the son of David had a fair sister, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the son of David loved her.
verses.web: After this, Absalom the son of David had a beautiful sister, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the son of David loved her.
verses.ct: Some time later, this happened: Absalom son of David had a beautiful sister named Tamar, and Amnon, another of David's sons, fell in love with her.

verses.kjv: And Amnon was so vexed, that he fell sick for his sister Tamar; for she was a virgin; and Amnon thought it hard for him to do anything to her.
verses.web: Amnon was so troubled that he became sick because of his sister Tamar; for she was a virgin; and it seemed hard to Amnon to do anything to her.
verses.ct: Amnon was so obsessed with his sister Tamar that it made him sick. She was a virgin, and he saw no way to get close to her.

verses.kjv: But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David’s brother: and Jonadab was a very subtil man.
verses.web: But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David’s brother; and Jonadab was a very subtle man.
verses.ct: But Amnon had a friend named Jonadab, the son of David's brother Shimeah. Jonadab was a very cunning man.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Why art thou, being the king’s son, lean from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? And Amnon said unto him, I love Tamar, my brother Absalom’s sister.
verses.web: He said to him, “Why, son of the king, are you so sad from day to day? Won’t you tell me?” Amnon said to him, “I love Tamar, my brother Absalom’s sister.”
verses.ct: Jonadab asked him, "You're the king's son — why do you look worse every day? Tell me what's going on." Amnon told him, "I'm in love with Tamar, my brother Absalom's sister."

verses.kjv: And Jonadab said unto him, Lay thee down on thy bed, and make thyself sick: and when thy father cometh to see thee, say unto him, I pray thee, let my sister Tamar come, and give me meat, and dress the meat in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it at her hand.
verses.web: Jonadab said to him, “Lay down on your bed, and pretend to be sick. When your father comes to see you, tell him, ‘Please let my sister Tamar come and give me bread to eat, and prepare the food in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it from her hand.’ ”
verses.ct: Jonadab said, "Here's what you do: lie down in your bed and pretend to be sick. When your father comes to check on you, tell him, 'Please let my sister Tamar come and prepare some food for me. Let her make it right here where I can watch, and then feed it to me herself.'"

verses.kjv: So Amnon lay down, and made himself sick: and when the king was come to see him, Amnon said unto the king, I pray thee, let Tamar my sister come, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat at her hand.
verses.web: So Amnon lay down and faked being sick. When the king came to see him, Amnon said to the king, “Please let my sister Tamar come, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat from her hand.”
verses.ct: So Amnon lay down and pretended to be sick. When the king came to see him, Amnon said, "Please let my sister Tamar come and make a couple of cakes right here in front of me, so I can eat from her hand."

verses.kjv: Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon’s house, and dress him meat.
verses.web: Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, “Go now to your brother Amnon’s house, and prepare food for him.”
verses.ct: David sent word to Tamar at the palace, saying, "Go to your brother Amnon's house and prepare some food for him."

verses.kjv: So Tamar went to her brother Amnon’s house; and he was laid down. And she took flour, and kneaded it, and made cakes in his sight, and did bake the cakes.
verses.web: So Tamar went to her brother Amnon’s house; and he was lying down. She took dough, and kneaded it, made cakes in his sight, and baked the cakes.
verses.ct: So Tamar went to Amnon's house, where he was lying in bed. She took flour, kneaded the dough, shaped the cakes right in front of him, and baked them.

verses.kjv: And she took a pan, and poured them out before him; but he refused to eat. And Amnon said, Have out all men from me. And they went out every man from him.
verses.web: She took the pan, and poured them out before him; but he refused to eat. Amnon said, “Have all men leave me.” Then every man went out from him.
verses.ct: She took the pan and served them to him, but he refused to eat. Then Amnon said, "Everyone get out." So everyone left the room.

verses.kjv: And Amnon said unto Tamar, Bring the meat into the chamber, that I may eat of thine hand. And Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon her brother.
verses.web: Amnon said to Tamar, “Bring the food into the room, that I may eat from your hand.” Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the room to Amnon her brother.
verses.ct: Then Amnon said to Tamar, "Bring the food into the bedroom so I can eat from your hand." Tamar picked up the cakes she had made and brought them into the bedroom to her brother Amnon.

verses.kjv: And when she had brought them unto him to eat, he took hold of her, and said unto her, Come lie with me, my sister.
verses.web: When she had brought them near to him to eat, he took hold of her, and said to her, “Come, lie with me, my sister!”
verses.ct: But when she brought them close for him to eat, he grabbed her and said, "Come sleep with me, my sister."

verses.kjv: And she answered him, Nay, my brother, do not force me; for no such thing ought to be done in Israel: do not thou this folly.
verses.web: She answered him, “No, my brother, do not force me! For no such thing ought to be done in Israel. Don’t you do this folly.
verses.ct: She pleaded with him, "No, my brother! Don't force me! This kind of thing should never happen in Israel. Don't do something so wicked."

verses.kjv: And I, whither shall I cause my shame to go? and as for thee, thou shalt be as one of the fools in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak unto the king; for he will not withhold me from thee.
verses.web: As for me, where would I carry my shame? And as for you, you will be as one of the fools in Israel. Now therefore, please speak to the king; for he will not withhold me from you.”
verses.ct: "Where would I go with my shame? And you — you'd be known as the worst kind of fool in Israel. Please, just talk to the king. He won't refuse to let you marry me."

verses.kjv: Howbeit he would not hearken unto her voice: but, being stronger than she, forced her, and lay with her.
verses.web: However he would not listen to her voice; but being stronger than she, he forced her, and lay with her.
verses.ct: But he wouldn't listen to her. He was stronger than she was, so he overpowered her and raped her.

verses.kjv: Then Amnon hated her exceedingly; so that the hatred wherewith he hated her was greater than the love wherewith he had loved her. And Amnon said unto her, Arise, be gone.
verses.web: Then Amnon hated her with exceedingly great hatred; for the hatred with which he hated her was greater than the love with which he had loved her. Amnon said to her, “Arise, be gone!”
verses.ct: Then immediately Amnon was filled with intense hatred toward her — a hatred even stronger than the desire he had felt before. He said to her, "Get up. Get out."

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, There is no cause: this evil in sending me away is greater than the other that thou didst unto me. But he would not hearken unto her.
verses.web: She said to him, “Not so, because this great wrong in sending me away is worse than the other that you did to me!” But he would not listen to her.
verses.ct: She said to him, "No — sending me away like this is an even greater wrong than what you already did to me!" But he refused to listen.

verses.kjv: Then he called his servant that ministered unto him, and said, Put now this woman out from me, and bolt the door after her.
verses.web: Then he called his servant who ministered to him, and said, “Now put this woman out from me, and bolt the door after her.”
verses.ct: He called his personal servant and said, "Get this woman out of here and bolt the door behind her."

verses.kjv: And she had a garment of divers colours upon her: for with such robes were the king’s daughters that were virgins apparelled. Then his servant brought her out, and bolted the door after her.
verses.web: She had a garment of various colors on her; for the king’s daughters who were virgins dressed in such robes. Then his servant brought her out and bolted the door after her.
verses.ct: Tamar was wearing a richly decorated robe — the kind that the king's virgin daughters wore. His servant threw her out and bolted the door behind her.

verses.kjv: And Tamar put ashes on her head, and rent her garment of divers colours that was on her, and laid her hand on her head, and went on crying.
verses.web: Tamar put ashes on her head, and tore her garment of various colors that was on her; and she laid her hand on her head, and went her way, crying aloud as she went.
verses.ct: Tamar put ashes on her head and tore the beautiful robe she was wearing. She put her hand on her head and walked away, weeping loudly as she went.

verses.kjv: And Absalom her brother said unto her, Hath Amnon thy brother been with thee? but hold now thy peace, my sister: he is thy brother; regard not this thing. So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom’s house.
verses.web: Absalom her brother said to her, “Has Amnon your brother been with you? But now hold your peace, my sister. He is your brother. Don’t take this thing to heart.” So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom’s house.
verses.ct: Her brother Absalom saw her and asked, "Has Amnon been with you?" Then he said, "Keep quiet for now, my sister. He's your brother. Don't let this destroy you." So Tamar lived in Absalom's house, devastated and alone.

verses.kjv: But when king David heard of all these things, he was very wroth.
verses.web: But when king David heard of all these things, he was very angry.
verses.ct: When King David heard about everything that had happened, he was furious.

verses.kjv: And Absalom spake unto his brother Amnon neither good nor bad: for Absalom hated Amnon, because he had forced his sister Tamar.
verses.web: Absalom spoke to Amnon neither good nor bad; for Absalom hated Amnon, because he had forced his sister Tamar.
verses.ct: Absalom never said a word to Amnon, good or bad. But he hated Amnon for what he had done to his sister Tamar.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after two full years, that Absalom had sheepshearers in Baalhazor, which is beside Ephraim: and Absalom invited all the king’s sons.
verses.web: After two full years, Absalom had sheep shearers in Baal Hazor, which is beside Ephraim: and Absalom invited all the king’s sons.
verses.ct: 2 full years went by. Then Absalom arranged for his sheep to be sheared at Baal Hazor, near Ephraim, and he invited all the king's sons to come.

verses.kjv: And Absalom came to the king, and said, Behold now, thy servant hath sheepshearers; let the king, I beseech thee, and his servants go with thy servant.
verses.web: Absalom came to the king, and said, “See now, your servant has sheep shearers. Please let the king and his servants go with your servant.”
verses.ct: Absalom went to the king and said, "Your servant is having his sheep sheared. Would the king and his officials please come and join me?"

verses.kjv: And the king said to Absalom, Nay, my son, let us not all now go, lest we be chargeable unto thee. And he pressed him: howbeit he would not go, but blessed him.
verses.web: The king said to Absalom, “No, my son, let’s not all go, lest we be burdensome to you.” He pressed him; however he would not go, but blessed him.
verses.ct: The king replied, "No, my son. If we all come, we'll be too much of a burden on you." Absalom kept pressing him, but David still wouldn't go — though he did give him his blessing.

verses.kjv: Then said Absalom, If not, I pray thee, let my brother Amnon go with us. And the king said unto him, Why should he go with thee?
verses.web: Then Absalom said, “If not, please let my brother Amnon go with us.” The king said to him, “Why should he go with you?”
verses.ct: Then Absalom said, "Well then, at least let my brother Amnon come with us." The king asked, "Why should he go with you?"

verses.kjv: But Absalom pressed him, that he let Amnon and all the king’s sons go with him.
verses.web: But Absalom pressed him, and he let Amnon and all the king’s sons go with him.
verses.ct: But Absalom kept insisting until David finally agreed to let Amnon and all the other princes go with him.

verses.kjv: Now Absalom had commanded his servants, saying, Mark ye now when Amnon’s heart is merry with wine, and when I say unto you, Smite Amnon; then kill him, fear not: have not I commanded you? be courageous, and be valiant.
verses.web: Absalom commanded his servants, saying, “Mark now, when Amnon’s heart is merry with wine; and when I tell you, ‘Strike Amnon,’ then kill him. Don’t be afraid. Haven’t I commanded you? Be courageous, and be valiant!”
verses.ct: Absalom had already given his servants their orders: "Watch carefully. When Amnon is drunk and in good spirits, and I give you the signal to strike him — kill him. Don't be afraid. I'm the one giving the command. Be brave and bold."

verses.kjv: And the servants of Absalom did unto Amnon as Absalom had commanded. Then all the king’s sons arose, and every man gat him up upon his mule, and fled.
verses.web: The servants of Absalom did to Amnon as Absalom had commanded. Then all the king’s sons arose, and every man got up on his mule, and fled.
verses.ct: Absalom's servants did exactly as he ordered and killed Amnon. All the other princes immediately jumped on their mules and fled.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, while they were in the way, that tidings came to David, saying, Absalom hath slain all the king’s sons, and there is not one of them left.
verses.web: While they were on the way, the news came to David, saying, “Absalom has slain all the king’s sons, and there is not one of them left!”
verses.ct: While they were still on the road, a report reached David: "Absalom has killed all the king's sons! Not one of them survived!"

verses.kjv: Then the king arose, and tare his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.
verses.web: Then the king arose, and tore his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes torn.
verses.ct: The king stood up, tore his clothes, and threw himself on the ground. All his officials standing nearby tore their clothes too.

verses.kjv: And Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David’s brother, answered and said, Let not my lord suppose that they have slain all the young men the king’s sons; for Amnon only is dead: for by the appointment of Absalom this hath been determined from the day that he forced his sister Tamar.
verses.web: Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David’s brother, answered, “Don’t let my lord suppose that they have killed all the young men the king’s sons; for Amnon only is dead; for by the appointment of Absalom this has been determined from the day that he forced his sister Tamar.
verses.ct: But Jonadab, the son of David's brother Shimeah, spoke up: "My lord should not think that all the young princes have been killed. Only Amnon is dead. Absalom has been planning this ever since the day Amnon raped his sister Tamar."

verses.kjv: Now therefore let not my lord the king take the thing to his heart, to think that all the king’s sons are dead: for Amnon only is dead.
verses.web: Now therefore don’t let my lord the king take the thing to his heart, to think that all the king’s sons are dead; for only Amnon is dead.”
verses.ct: "So my lord the king, don't take it to heart thinking all your sons are dead. Only Amnon has been killed."

verses.kjv: But Absalom fled. And the young man that kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came much people by the way of the hill side behind him.
verses.web: But Absalom fled. The young man who kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold, many people were coming by way of the hillside behind him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Absalom had fled. The watchman on duty looked up and saw a large group of people coming along the road from the hillside behind him.

verses.kjv: And Jonadab said unto the king, Behold, the king’s sons come: as thy servant said, so it is.
verses.web: Jonadab said to the king, “Behold, the king’s sons are coming! It is as your servant said.”
verses.ct: Jonadab said to the king, "Look — the king's sons are coming! It's just as I told you."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of speaking, that, behold, the king’s sons came, and lifted up their voice and wept: and the king also and all his servants wept very sore.
verses.web: As soon as he had finished speaking, behold, the king’s sons came, and lifted up their voice, and wept. The king also and all his servants wept bitterly.
verses.ct: He had barely finished speaking when the king's sons arrived. They burst into loud weeping, and the king and all his officials wept bitterly with them.

verses.kjv: But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai, the son of Ammihud, king of Geshur. And David mourned for his son every day.
verses.web: But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai the son of Ammihur, king of Geshur. David mourned for his son every day.
verses.ct: Absalom fled to Talmai son of Ammihud, the king of Geshur. David mourned for his son day after day.

verses.kjv: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.
verses.web: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.
verses.ct: After fleeing to Geshur, Absalom stayed there for 3 years.

verses.kjv: And the soul of king David longed to go forth unto Absalom: for he was comforted concerning Amnon, seeing he was dead.
verses.web: King David longed to go out to Absalom; for he was comforted concerning Amnon, since he was dead.
verses.ct: King David's soul longed to go to Absalom, because over time his grief over Amnon's death had eased, since Amnon was gone.
